snippet: More than 100,000 customers were without safe tap water on Thursday after a chemical used to clean coal leaked into the Elk River in Charleston, W.Va., officials said.
abstract: More than West Virginia 100,000 customers are without safe tap water after chemical used to clean coal leaks into the Elk River in Charleston, W Va.
lead_paragraph: More than 100,000 customers were without safe tap water on Thursday after a chemical used to clean coal leaked into the Elk River in Charleston, W.Va., officials said.

headline.main: Chemical Spill Fouls Water in West Virginia
headline.print_headline: Chemical Spill Fouls Water In W. Virginia
